I was shocked by the size of our room and it was a very comfortable bed in a comfortable, quiet room. We had a great view of the bay and city skyline. Would stay here again.

The location was the best thing about this hotel is the room layout, bathrooms are small, but in need of a refurb. Breakfast was good - no fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, fruit and coffee. Would stay here again.

Although the room was a bit dated, I was not expecting much. We stayed in a suite which was clean and comfortable. Would stay here again if we had a chance to use the gym facilities, but would definitely stay again.
The hotel is not so good for me and the fact that it's an older property. No problem with my room service, but it was quite expensive, so I can't comment on that.

When you arrive at the door you are stuck in the lobby from the room, but you can't get lost. I would have to say the room itself was not as clean as it should be. If you are looking for a good hotel and its location, you will not be disappointed.
We would like to stay there for a week. We had a room on the 4th floor overlooking the canal and in a very nice location. Rooms were clean, but better than that.
The room was a good size and the bed was comfortable. The location is quite good for exploring the city by foot, and the metro is within walking distance.
The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a bit expensive ($10), but the food was good.
We loved staying here on our honeymoon. Room was fine, but the beds were comfortable and we had a nice meal in the room.
We are already planning our return trip to New Orleans and stayed for one night, and the room was huge. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Very clean and well kept.
We stayed there for one night, room was clean and the bathroom was a little small. Would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in a small room, but it was fine for us.

It was a surprise: the rooms were spacious and well appointed and had all the facilities that are needed. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a great location, but in a good way.
It was a really big disappointment for us. Very clean and spacious room with a nice view from the balcony
Our room was small, but comfortable and clean. The bathroom was a bit small and the shower didn't work properly.

We will be staying here for a few weeks in a row. Room was clean, but the room was tiny, the bathroom was tiny and the sink was a bit difficult to get in. But it was a bit too far out of the way, but I would not stay here again.
Although I was on a business trip, I had to be moved to a suite for a few days. Our room was clean and quiet. On the plus side the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.
The room was very nice and the beds are comfy. Will definitely be back!
The room is a little bit small, but they have the best shower room in the bathroom. The bed was so comfortable, the room was clean and the location is excellent.
I have to say that we were not impressed by the big hotels in this area. Our room was clean, quiet and the bed was comfortable. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay somewhere else.
I was worried about the noise in this hotel but it was definitely a great stay. We had no problems with noise from the street, and we could not have been more pleased with this place.
The rooms are quite small and the bathrooms are a bit dated, but overall it is a good choice for business travelers.

aspect_meansum_location.summary: What a great location. I was so happy with the hotel, and would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in the center of Florence. It is very close to all the sights.

We would like to say that the hotel is located in a great location. Steps away from metro station and walking distance to some of the major tourist sites. Rooms are small but clean, but be prepared to have a comfortable sleep.
We do not have a lot of time to stay at this hotel because it is located right on the strip, but we had a great time. Clean and quiet, great location - close to the strip.
This is our second time staying at this resort. It's a great place to stay in the middle of the action and the best restaurants in the world.
We really enjoyed my stay at the W Hotel. It is an old building, so it's in a great location.
We would like to stay in the Hotel Muguet when visiting Rome. It is a very pleasant, clean, quiet and comfortable hotel. The location is good, near the train station.
The hotel is located in a great location, just off the Ramblas. Clean and modern. Staff was friendly and helpful - would definitely stay there again.
It is right on the train station and a short walk to the hotel. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly - we had 3 rooms with a balcony.
I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place to stay before we left. Very good location, the staff were very friendly and the location is superb.
This is a great hotel in an excellent location. Very close to the Grand Bazaar, and the Vatican Museum
The hotel is very close to the central station, and within walking distance of all the sights. Rooms are clean and comfortable, with a good view of the city from the window

This is an ideal location to visit all the main sites of Venice, but so close to the airport. My husband and I are hoping to have a hard time finding a hotel in Venice for our trip to Venice, we will be back!
Stayed at this hotel on the recommendation of a friend who was on the way to a business trip. It was very comfortable and the staff were helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
This is a great hotel for a good price. Rooms are small but clean and in great condition.

This is a really nice hotel with the location of the central station. It is in a quiet street so you can walk anywhere in Rome. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.
The hotel is located in a great spot close to all the major sites. Very close to the Spanish Steps, but not too far from it. Would definitely return to this wonderful place and hope to return soon.
I was there with my family. We had a lovely time in Istanbul and the hotel is just perfect. We had a lovely view of the city from our window. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
It is a decent hotel and great location for walking around the city. Would stay here again!

We are a family of four, and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the airport and close to everything. In the morning you are in the heart of the city.
Although the location is not great, this hotel is centrally located. Service was excellent and I would stay here again. I would stay here again.

I would recommend the hotel. It is in a great location, walking distance from the Louvre, Notre Dame, etc. We had a room with a balcony, which is very nice and comfortable. We will definitely stay there again. It is a good value for money.
We have just returned from a week at the Hilton Garden Inn and it was perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but we will be back. What a great find!
That is the only positive thing about this hotel. Very good location, but not the best value for money.
This is the second time I stayed at this hotel. It is located in the historic center of town, within walking distance of all major sights and a great place to stay.
The Royal York is a great place to stay in the city! The beach is great and are very nice.

aspect_qt_building.summary: One other thing worth mentioning for those who travel with lots of luggage - there is no lift/elevator. The hotel is on the first floor of an old building which smelt badly. Mike will set you straight on this.
The lobby is spacious, bright and comfortable. Also, the business center computers are free. Didn't have a chance to check out the fitness facility. We only used the stairs which were so convenient.

Beautiful pool. The pool area is very nice and large with several water features. -Staff outside of lobby are not overly friendly. The pool area and tiki bar are fabulous with drink specials everyday.
Pool is kind of small. There is also an indoor pool open till 11pm. We did not use the pools, but they seemed well maintained to me.

The balconies are small but serviceable. An inviting and elegant lobby. The hotel lobby is tastefully decorated and comfortable. There isn't a gym inside the hotel; but they have access to a very small facility about one block away.
The lobby was small, but very well kept and beautiful. The internet is free, with 3 provided computers. The lobby is just OK. The swimming pool was closed for repair, but hey, we had the sea!
And there was no way you'd be able to relax by the pool. It was a lounge area with a nice pool and very nice jacuzzi. Although sunny we didn't brave the pool.
The pool was nice and clean but freezing. Unless you seeking a hotel with a pool I would recommend you stay elsewhere. The only great thing was the pool which was wonderful.
One of the lifts didnt work. I believe that if you stay on the 7th floor you will most likely get a balcony which was a real treat! No free internet. There is a small bar/lounge area off the lobby.
We had our own private balcony surrounded with flowers. The lift stopped on the floor below! The elderly, handicapped and those with more than one bag will find this challenging.
The bath was about the size of one in an airplane, but there was a small pub on site, and it was a short walk to downtown. At least I got my exercise during the night.

View overlooking the swimming pool. internet in the lobby. There is a pool table, a large sitting area, a bar, a courtyard, etc. They had free WI-FI in the lobby and bar. This meant occassionally negotiating the stairs at night.
Super fast free internet with a printer. The hotel lobby is warm and cosy. The temperature was in the 85 - 90 degree range and the terrace was so hot we could not use it at all.
We had to go to the lobby area to connect. Nothing really fancy and no pool, but for the money exceptional.
The wi-fi rarely worked during our stay and only down in the lobby. Not a big deal but not the in-room balcony that I expected/hoped for.
The stairs were very unique-made of glass and artfully arranged. There is free WiFi and a free public computer. They were extremely accommodating - wonderful with the children and very helpful.

Loved and really enjoyed the lobby area. They do offer free wired Internet on a computer in the lobby. The balcony had 2 lounge chairs and pretty flowers. But, oh my, my daughter and I had a wonderful time!
2X to get down to the lobby. Shower not a tub. Internet was available in a business center in the lobby.
Room was big enough for both of our bikes. The Murray Hill also has a very adequate gym and workout facility. Nice lobby! We had a few internet disruptions during our stay but not too long.
No gym or pool but vouchers given for a nearby one. The lobby is very small. We did have a balcony witha decent view which made up for the size.
Elevator tiny and we would have liked to keep our key but that was not an issue. The free WiFi access is a huge asset. The hotel does have a lift.
And the pool was great. The pool was just what we needed to cool off on a hot day (100 degrees) while watching the sunset in the bay.

Nice pool. The lobby looks very nice. They have 3 computers in their business center, but could use more. If you don't exercise, then this is a great hotel and I really recommend it for the close proximity to SEATAC.
Bright colors, skateboards, butterfly chirs and a grand ocean/boardwalk view (always entertaining). There is a small balcony, but there's only a small glass divider between your neighbor's balcony.
Each pool is delightfully warm, one slightly warmer than the next. There was an outdoor pool and hot tub and an indoor pool. The 3 pools were all well maintained and relaxing.

aspect_qt_service.summary: The staff is very nice. The staff was helpful and pleasant also. The staff were very friendly and breakfast was included. The owner, Corey (Corrado) speaks fluent English, as does most of his staff.

The staff was helpful. Great service. The staff was kind, warm and hospitable. This was a great place to stay while visiting Rome, we would highly recomend it. was a complete bother to the front desk.

What a fantastic staff. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Yes, the staff are welcoming. Service from the staff was truly outstanding and always friendly! Thank you! The service was wonderful. Rooms were nice and clean.

The staff was very nice and polite! The staff was courteous and helpful. Christina at the front desk was so helpful and friendly. Never will book here again! The service was good. Thumbs up!! Lazy staff and incompetent.

The staff was courteous and very helpful. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Very good service. The staff was uniformly helpful and gracious. What a treat. The staff and the location are fantastic. It was nice.

A very friendly and helpful staff. The staff are very smiley and extremely courteous, very accomodating and friendly. The staff in the reception was very helpfull and the service was great. Service - is good. There was something for everyone.

The staff was very helpful. The staff was friendly and very polite. Service - excellent. On arrival, we were greated by two lovely members of staff who made us all feel very welcome. BIG MISTAKE! Breakfast is more than ok.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. staff was amazing. It was very nice and the waiting staff were great. Very impressed. Aside from some Wi-Fi issues at the front desk, we had a most pleasant stay.

The staff was excellent. We found the front of house staff 'aloof bordering on rude and arrogant. The hotel stafff was marginally helpful. The staff never seem to change. The staff at the hotel were courteous and friendly.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The staff was professional. The staff was fantastic. The service was outstanding. In particular, Marco at the front desk was a pleasure. The desk staff and bellman were all extremely welcoming. Pleasant Staff.
Very friendly staff. The staff is polite and helpful, they made sure to make feel wellcome. They didn't tell me. Very professional and courteous. The service is very effective.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Lastly, the staff was very friendly and always smiling and very polite. The staff was variable. We'd come again in a heartbeat! The front desk was very helpful with maps and suggestions, too.

The staff is friendly and helpful. The front desk staff, especially Laia, were great. Would stay again here. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff can make you any resrvation for a restaurant or help you accordingly.

The staff was very nice. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and made us feel very welcome. Service was excellent. Every member of the staff we encountered was gracious, friendly and helpful.

We arrived and the staff was extremely friendly. As discussed the staff were very nice and helpful. Among the staff, Alessandro deserves special mention as particularly hospitable and helpful. The Grifo really tries. What is this all about?
The staff were very helpful and friendly. We'd love to return someday. Just ask the front desk.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Service was great! The staff were very gracious. Don't be fooled by limo (shared taxi) drivers in arrivals. We would like to sincerely thank the hotel for their assistance and empathy.
The staff was very friendly and helpful. The staff was amazing. The hotel is nice with a great staff. The front desk staff was very rude. You shouldn't come here either. Staff was very accommodating.

The staff was helpful. The staff was quite friendly and knowledgable. The staff were most accomodating. The doorman was prompt and courteous, the staff friendly and knowledgeable. Very disappointing. The hotel was clean and the service staff were very efficient.

The staff are friendly and always helpful. The staff were curteous. The service was great! I was treated like a queen by the staff and Hugo and Lauren were absolutely hotel class and professionalism at its best.

The staff was friendly and very nice. The staff was very accommadating and nice.They did speak english very well. A very enjoyable stay. Friendly staff, decent breakfast (baguettes, croissants, cereal, yogurts, etc). The staff is very polite and helpful.

The staff is phenom - always friendly and helpful. The best staff of any hotel we've stayed in. The staff is top notch. The service is great. The staff was great at remembering us and greeting us warmly.
The staff was very nice. Good service from front desk staff. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. Superbly helpful and friendly staff. Would I stay here again?
The staff is great. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The staff excel and nothing is ever too much trouble.

The staff was friendly and helpful. They were very accomodating. The staff is wonderful and so nice. Thank you! I am happy to report...She Loved It! It turns out there have been many unhappy guests here.

aspect_qt_cleanliness.summary: The room was clean and very basic - no complaints with that. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Our room was small, which was fine. And the rooms were absolutely spotless.

Our room was comfortable and spotless. The room was nice. Clean spacious rooms. We loved the rooms! The room was clean and quiet. That is why I was pleasantly surprised to have free internet access in the room.
The rooms are very small. Our room was perfect and clean. Our room was spotless! Linens were clean. -Other than the floor, my room was fine. This hotel is great. The room was very nice for the price.
The room was nice, clean and spacious. The rooms are okay. The rooms are ok! Our room was very average. We paid for an Oceanveiw room and were placed on the ground floor with a veiw of the roof.

The room was quite spacious, well decorated and very clean. And the room - mon dieu! Plenty of room to spread out. A great hotel! We were told that the room has just been renovated. We would stay again.

The room was clean. The room is otherwise comfortable and well maintained. The rooms were comfortable and really modern, clean and nice. We were surprised by a bottle of champagne in our room. My only complaint.
The room was comfortable and clean. The room was very good. The rooms are very modern and very nice. This hotel is just great! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.
The room was lovely, comfortable and clean. The rooms are spacious. They offered to move me to a quieter room the next night.

Our room was spotless and comfortable. The rooms were clean and well maintained and was quite comfortable. Their room was beautiful. The rooms were a decent size. The rooms were small, tired and worn.

Our room was small but very clean and comfortable. The chandelier was beautiful and the room was beautifully decorated. Venice is really something impossible to describe, centuries years of art in such a small place !

The room was clean and spacious. The light floods into the room. The rooms and cleanliness were fine. The rooms are modern, clean. This hotel was excellent. We were impressed with our room. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

The room was small but comfortable. The rooms were clean and spacious. Our room was miniscule. The staff was extremely helpful, and the rooms were charming. Would recommend this hotel. I enjoyed this hotel.
Our room was of a good size and very comfortable. The rooms were small but very well appointed and comfortable. We had a triple room. The staff is helpful and the rooms are clean.
The room was clean and comfy. The rooms are nice, comfortable and clean. The room was great. We would definitely stay here again. And that our room was upgraded! I would definately stay here again.
The room was basic but quite clean. The rooms are very clean and well kept. The room was perfect. The room was small, but comfortable. Our room was on the top floor and we had a view which was great.

The room was very stylish and spacious. We had one of the rooms that had the Bedroom on top. The room was awesome. We stayed in a duplex room. Would highly recommend this hotel. This hotel was wonderful!

My room was modern and very clean. The rooms were small but well equipped. The room was attractive and comfortable. Breakfast room was beautifully lit and comfortably large. Would definately stay here again.

The room was small, but well equipped. Our room was small, but nicely appointed. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean. When I book a room at a hotel I expect to stay there, not somewhere else.

The room was spacious and comfortable. The rooms are big and clean. The room was quiet and very clean. We would definitely stay here again. We would definately stay here again. The view from my room is also nice.
Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The rooms are small. The room was amazing. ROOM: Decoration of the room is very modern. Had an issue with the first room I stayed in due to noise.
The room was very clean. The rooms was very pleasant, clean and tidy. The room was tiny and smelly . Our room overlooked the street, but was quiet and very comfortable.
The room was beautiful and spacious. Good sized room. The room was nice and big. The room was very comfortable and well-appointed, and very clean.

The room was clean and comfortable. The rooms were a bit dated but spacious. Although the room was clean, it was cluttered and dark. I reported this to the front desk and they moved us to a different room.

Our room was very clean and comfortable. The rooms are great. The room was clean and retrofitted with all the right amenities. Our room was very quiet. Our room was very large, light, comfortable, and beautifully and artfully decorated.

The rooms are always clean. I would definitely stay here again. The room was large, modestly appointed and clean. The only thing I missed was in room coffee. Our room was amazing, spacious, clean, tastefully decorated. We'd be back.

aspect_qt_food.summary: The breakfast was so-so but was available. The breakfast was filling if nothing and I loved the orange juice served in a plastic cup.
The breakfast buffet was fabulous. Also, breakfast was included with our stay. I got the free breakfast with my upgrades. Any question about restaurants, shopping, etc.
Continental breakfast was very good. There is also a many franchise restaurants and grocery stores nearby. Another plus is an above-average complimentary breakfast buffet served poolside.
They had a restaurant for breakfast and lunch. We ate breakfast and it was good. It took an hour before the got our food served, for breakfast! Not that great. We love it! Definately not.

Many excellent restaurants nearby. The breakfast was just so-so. In summary - fantastic hotel but avoid the restaurant. Oh, and there's free breakfast. Also, conceige was helpful with directions but restaurant recommmendations were no better than our random selections.
Overall this is a great hotel but let down by the breakfast. The breakfast is good, though a little variation would be welcomed. Plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. Breakfast was fine.
The service was great and breakfast was ample, with the usual cereals, breads and cheeses etc. The buffet breakfast leaves rather a lot to be desired. It's also near very good restaurants and bars.
I loved the breakfast buffet with lots of fruit and different joghurts and home made pastries. In Aldrovandi they have now their prominent restaurant with Michelin chief-cook.
The breakfast was nice. There was a nice bar and restaurant in the hotel but they were quite expensive. The eggs and breakfast meats looked a little dubious.

very nice and has a great breakfast. We especially enjoyed the lovely breakfast room. Unfortunately there are no other types of restaurant e.g. The breakfast buffet was very good and in a beautiful space.

Always very clean and quiet, excellent breakfast. We did not eat breakfast here. good breakfast, lots of buffet food. Arthur Frommer located within walking distance of Dam Square, Rembrandt Square, Rijksmuseum, restaurants, shopping and canals.
The breakfast is simple but plentiful. We got a great rate with the breakfast buffet included which made our stay here palatable. Excellent breakfast with good selection of food.
Good breakfast. There's a good selection of local bars and restaurants in the surrounding area. This hotel could be improved by offering a free breakfast.

The breakfast was average. We availed of the breakfast, which was lovely and headed out to the French Quarter. In order to get to the bars and restaurants, you have to walk through a really ghetto section.
And also the breakfast was good. Angela on breakfast was very pleasant and very efficient. Also, I would like to compliment the hotel on their complimentary breakfast.

The breakfast was excellent. The on site restaurant was very nice. They gave a lot of good recommendations for restaurants. Breakfast was served in La Rivista which is the hotel restaurant. Would highly recommend.

The breakfast was great too. There are many restaurants and shops nearby. The breakfast was very good and the room where it was served was very nice. The included breakfast itself is tasty and has a nice variety of selections.
On site restaurant was good as well. The hotel has a small bar and the restaurant is fine. There is also a Corner Bakery right next door which was great for breakfast and lunch. Not great.
Scotty's diner around the corner has great food. and there are lots of restaurants and convenient stores nearby. Plenty of enjoyable restaurants nearby, especially Cibo around the corner.
The restaurant was very good. It was great! The restaurant attached to the hotel is beautiful, although we only ate there once during our five days. The assistant g.m.
We had breakfast once and this was fine, all fresh and plenty. There is plenty served, and the convenience of having the breakfast in the hotel is terrific.

My one disappointment with the FS is the restaurant. We ate our breakfast at ART and everthing was delicious, especially the lemon ricotta pancakes. Ordered room service for breakfast... it was late by 20 minutes.
The breakfast was okay. The breakfast was the typical Comp. The restaurant was fine. This is good, because there are no other restaurants within walking distance. The breakfast was ordinary.
We had a great breakfast at Hash too! The restaurant (LUSH) was amazing. Lots of good resturants within walking distance and some even deliver. The rooftop bar HIGH was the icing on the cake.

Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. I had missed the deadline for the wedding party prices. The nearby restaurants and bookstores and shopping options are fun. It doesn't get better than that.

aspect_qt_rooms.summary: The room & bathroom was dirty. Absolutely the worst bed i've ever slept in. We had a large room with four beds, and were very comfortable.

The room and bathrom were constantly cleaned and refreshed. Our room was ready as soon as we checked in, the room was big for european standards and very well kept and clean. The bathroom was small too.

The bathroom was huge--especially considering how small the room was. The bathroom was also very clean. The pool area is fantastic and the rooms are always clean and adequate in terms of size. Our room smelled strongly of mildew.
The bathroom was small but clean. It was one of the most SPACIOUS rooms we have gotten in an oceanfront hotel! Our room was very average. The room was very large and the bed was comfortable.
The bed was very comfortable. The room was spacious and comfortable with a really luxurious bathroom. The room was really good, a big bath suitable for two and a separate stand up shower.
A functional modern bathroom. The room was rather small (we got room 211). It was very spacious and clean and had a big bathroom and lots of room to spread out.

It's a modern hotel with big modern rooms with flatscreen. The room was nicely decorated, modern and clean with a lovely bathroom, perfect. The room was clean and comfortable with a free room safe which was a welcome find.
We received an upgrade on the room, which was spacious and delicate. The bathroom again was small and of average standard. The hotel was lovely with nice spacious rooms.
The bathroom was large and seemed cleaner than the room. The bathroom was clean and the facilities all worked well. We opened our screenless windows to cool the room down.

Our room did not have a canal view, but was a good size and clean, with a nice clean and quite spacious bathroom. The first room that we were given was an 'attick' room and we could not stand upright.
The double bed was spacious and very comfortable and we slept well. The bathroom is not to big, but enough.
My room was small, but lovely, and the bathroom was large, by European standards. The bathroom also was fine. Our bed was in a loft which gave our room an airy, spacious feel.
Our room was a good size with large bathroom and all cons necessary. The bathroom/shower was fine. The room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable.
The room was large with two queen beds. The bed was comfortable. We didn't get a suite, but we each essentially got our own room. Our room had two bedrooms, connected by a bathroom.
Initially, we balked and asked to see another room. The room and bathroom are not fit for 4 people. A comfortable room, and bed especially. The bed was a bit stiff. Our room had so much dust.
The bed was a little hard but adequate and a good size. The room was modern, bathroom smaller than normal (but nothing to complain about) and everything was very clean. Great bathroom.

Room and bathroom size pretty good. The room was much larger than most European rooms, very clean. (If you're not sharing a bed with someone, you're probably not comfortable with them showering in the middle of the room!).
So very happy with the room. My room was a basic Club Quarters room - standard amenities. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. We booked a room with two double beds.
The room we stayed at had 2 full size bed and a sleeper sofa. The bathroom was small but tidy and well maintained. They placed me in a room with one bed. Bed was awful, with a dip in middle.
The bathroom was quite spacious. The bathroom was nicely equipped and the room was completely silent.
The room were ok size for Paris, a little dated but clean and a good bathroom. The room was a decent size and the bed was comfortable. This is a small hotel - about 5 rooms per floor.
i had to pry room cleaning out of the housekeeping deparrment(they said they clean rooms between 9 and 5:30). The bathroom is huge. This bed was uber comfy.
We arrived and were presented with a one queen bed, in a very small handicapped room. Getting to the room we discovered there was was space for a rollaway, but it was not in the room.

The room was spacious and had really cool furnishings, and the beds were comfortable. The room's were good, and we had a free upgrade for one of them (for a Facebook 'like!) A+ for the bed and pillows.

The rooms are clean and attractive with comfortable beds. Our room was clean and comfortable and the bed actually firm [! We enjoyed having that convience of a kitchen in our room. The bed was incredibly stiff.

aspect_qt_location.summary: It's about a two minute walk away from both Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. The location of the hotel was superb. Ideal location!
Its location at the top of Via Veneto is very close to anything you want to see in Rome. Beautiful hotel, great location. The location was ideal. Similar to those in San Francisco or Washington DC.
Good location. They are in a decent location with grocery and other stores nearby with a 5min bike ride to Duval street. I would not walk. Great hotel, great location, nice and quite.
We came back to the Grand because the location is perfect. Great hotel layout and a great location. Best of all, it was right on the beach and boardwalk!
Great location. Good central location mid in the romantic old Montreal, close to great restaurants and easy to get around town. It is centrally located , walking distance to everything.

It was the perfect location. The hotel location is a very short walking distance to the Ramblas. No regrets.The location, on a quiet street with it's proximity to the Placa de Catalunya, La Ramblas and restaurants was perfect.
I really liked the location and the hotel. I liked the location as it is in close proximity to the Ramblas and two blocks away from Casa Mila. The location wasn't too bad.
Starting off the location is stunning. I would recommend this hotel, but would not stay there again ONLY because of the location. Distance to Rome city centre is a 15 min walk through a lovely park.

Positives: Good location, within walking distance to St. Peter's Square & Castel de San Angelo. The location was great. The location is great if you are mainly interested in the Vatican and St Peters. Very close to Vatican City.
The hotel's location is a 10. The location is excellent; only a minute from San Marco and not far from the Rialto Bridge and Market. Also close are all the vaporetti stops just about 3 blocks away.
It is in a pretty and peaceful location, but within easy walking distance of restaurants and centre. The location near Prinsengracht is very good.
It was a great location. The location was perfect, being 5 min from the rialto bridge and close to lots of bars, restaurants and gondalas. About a 10-15 minute walk to St. Mark's square.
We were only a block and a half from a metro stop. The location was good too. The hotel lies 1.5 blocks friom the metro.

The location of the hotel was excellent. The location was only about three blocks off of Bourbon St. and close enough that I walked everywhere. The location of the Quality Inn and Suites is also very convenient.

The location of the hotel is good. You are 10/15 mins walk from main train station, but just 5/10 to the Colosseum or Piazza Venezia. The location is brilliant. You just walk down the road to get to the Coloseum.
The location is perfect! The location is great, in a quiet section near the Accademia Bridge away from most of the tourist traffic. Location was terrific. I loved Venice and I loved this hotel.
I was travelling alone so the proximity to just everything was quite appreciated (5 to 15 minutes from Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Pantheon and other must-see sites). The location was fantastic.
The location was excellent. Best thing was the terrific location just steps off Mag Mile and close to Millennium Park. It's not perfect but you can't beat the price and location.
The location was great. It is about 8 minutes walk from the grand central station, very convenient. this is hardly a nice place. Quiet and convenient and reasonably priced.
The location is fantastic. The location is terrific two blocks from Times Square and about 5 blocks from Rockefeller Center. GREAT location - between 5th Avenue and Times Square.
The big plus is the location, which is essentially next to a Metro stop, as well as close to many shops/restaurants. The location is ideal. This hotel is in an excellent location.
The location could not be better. Oh yeah, the location is awesome with a great view and right by the Pike Place market and walking distance to everything downtown.
Would stay again at this location. They also provide free transportation to and from the airport. Computers are available in the business center.

The location is perfect. We hardly venture far as everything we need is within walking distance, but for the sightseers the buses are on the doorstep. It's maybe a 40 minute walk on the boardwalk to the Santa Monica Pier.
The location was great just off the main street and close to everything. The location is excellent as well. All in all, its the best spot in the area. What a place to unwind.

centroid_general.summary: My wife and I just stayed at this hotel with 2 friends for several nights. It is in a great location in the center of Rome. The Pantheon and the Piazza Navona are just a few minutes walk away. You are very close to lots of food and shopping. The price was excellent for being in the center of Rome in season. The rooms were clean and roomy. The hotel staff was very good. Mike and the hotel owner were great and helped us with any reservations and ideas for outings that we needed. A simple breakfast comes with the room, bread, juice, coffee/tea, but if you are looking for something more you will need to go out. This is not a luxery hotel with alot of amenities, but if you are looking for a great location, clean quiet rooms at a good price, this is a great choice.

My wife and I recently stayed at the Flora on a short stop-over in Rome to elsewhere in Italy. The room was very nice and large by European standards, overlooking a large park. The bathroom and public areas were exceptionally nice. We stayed on hotel loyalty points and were upgraded to the executive level. Breakfast on the top level overlooked the city and the view, food, and service were all tremendous. The staff was very polite and helpful in resolving a luggage issue with our airline. This is not the most convenient location in Rome, but it is in a very attractive area that is quieter than a lot of the city. I would very much recommend this hotel.

My husband and I did not know what to expect as we had not been to Key West before. This hotel was the cheapest of the chains hotels and we really weren't sure about the accomodations. We were greated by smiling, friendly staff - including the hotel manager - who immediately gave us a drink and mardi gras beads. We found that we had been upgraded to a suite - it was pretty sweet! The pool is georgeous with fountains spraying into the pool (which is heated :o) it made a swim perfect as it was a little chilly out). The room was very nice for the price. These are not 5 star accomodations, but they are the best for the price that you pay. We were able to park under the lights both nights we were there. We would definitely stay here again.

We came to Ocean City to celebrate our sons 4th birthday. We are true beach lovers and have stayed at many places in OC. Our main concern was clean, comfortable place to stay that is close to the beach. The hotel was very clean, beds were pretty comfortable, and the view was so so.The rooms are huge but bathrooms very small. We had a grandview room (sort of on the side) but it is not private from your neighbors at all. Probably the only complaint was the elavators. There were only 2 of the 4 working so it made for alot of rude behavior because everyone wanted to go and they werent willing to compromise. Typical! Overall a very nice trip. We would definitely return!

My husband and daughter (age 14) spent two nights at the Hotel St. Sulpice in Montreal. The hotel is located in Old Montreal and very close to the Cathedral. We chose the hotel because it offered a suite with an enclosed bedroom so we could have privacy. We were delighted with the tastefully decorated room, comfortable bed & comfortable enough pullout sofa; with the quaint balcony, and extremely professional service at the front desk. We also received free breakfast for 2 each morning and that was delicious too. I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat. Another plus, the hotel lobby had a subtle but nice fragrance - verbena, I think. Really nice. This hotel would be equally good for business travelers, families with older children and friends on a weekend shopping/cultural trip. You can walk to the shops and restaurants of Old Montreal. Did I miss anything? Go there!! The cathedral "light show was kinda, okay very, hokey but still informative. Don't get me started on the bus tour....skip that.

My daughter and I stayed here on a sight seeing trip to Barcelona. We found the Hotel to be centrally located, easy access to Catalunya Square, from where you can visit most of the tourist sites. Our room, was large, good bathroom, only downside was that it faced buildings at the back of the Hotel. No view. Room was clean and adequately furnished for a few days stay. Bedside rug did need a good steam clean!! Trendy looking, comfortable bar, though on a Monday night this was very, very, quiet. After leaving for the airport, we discovered we'd left a mobile phone in the bedroom. On contacting Reception from the airport, we luckily heard it had been found and would be posted back to us. It arrived safe and sound 2 weeks later. Many, many thanks to those concerned at Reception. Would recommend this Hotel, but ask for a room with a view and a little iron balcony.

We visited this hotel for a weekend in March. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. We had no problems with noise and the beds were comfy. The location was decent as it's only a step away from the metro which gets you everywhere quickly! We didn't have any food in the hotel, we thought it was overpriced. Coffee was good though and the rooftop is fab even in March. La Pedrera is a few minutes walk away as is all the higher end shopping eg Gucci. We were very pleased with our choice of hotel all things considered and £70 per room seemed a bargain. NB Take you own hairdryer, the bathroom ones are next to useless - reception will lend you a travel plug if you are silly enough to bring an American one as I did! Barcelona was a great city with loads to do and very friendly people!

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights recently in June 2011. We chose this hotel because we wanted luxury accommodation and an opportunity to relax at a pool. We were not disappointed at all. This is a wonderful hotel located on the outskirts of the tranquil Villa Borghese gardens. It is a short cab ride of a few minutes to any of the attractions in Rome. Staff were friendly and helpful and particularly Mario at the front desk Rooms are large and bright and the pool and gardens are a wonderful retreat after a day of hectic touring in the heat. The rooms and gardens are quiet and peaceful Food prices are way way up there so we did not eat in the restaurant although it is apparently one of the finest in Rome. Breakfast was included and was excellent. Would definitely stay here again particularly in the summer months.

We stayed a few nights at this hotel as a part of a tour group. The hotel staff seemed put off or indifferent to answer questions many travelers may have. The internet site on the main floor may or may not work, again, the hotel staff couldn't be bothered with that trivial matter. The rooms were clean and well maintained and was quite comfortable. Breakfasts were OK, and we never did eat in the main dining room or bar. Overal, this hotel is well kept, clean, and comfortable. Hotel Cicerone is situated in a great location. There are a number of gelato shops and restaurants nearby. An outdoor market is not far. Around the corner from Cicerone is a nice coffee shop which has much better cappucino than the hotel. Cicerone is within a short walking distance from Castle S. Angelo, The Vatican, and Piazza Novona. Across the street is a quaint pizzaria for a quick meal. I've had better house wine, but pleasant to sit outdoors and enjoy a meal. Despite the neutral attitude of the hotel staff, I would recomend this hotel, and would definately stay there again.

This is a wonderful hotel. It is a 3 minute walk from San Marco Square and less than 10 minutes from the Rialto Bridge. The staff could not have been nicer. We arrived on a very busy weekend were given a room we did not like, while nice enough it had a view of cement and brick walls. I was pretty upset, but Alessandro put us in a fantastic room with an even better view. The room change made everything perfect for our stay and we canâ€™t thank him enough. I would recommend this hotel without reservation except for the basement room in the annex; donâ€™t book it. If you go, please say hello to Alessandro from the Taylors. We loved our stay and can't wait to return.

We visited this hotel in late March, and found it to be really agreable. It is in a perfect location - tram stops are a few minutes walk from it in either direction - to Leidseplein or the Dam and all other tourist attractions in between. Or if the weather is nice (it was freeezing last week) you can easily walk to everywhere. Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, the room was a decent size, with comfortable beds, tv, mini bar, and large shower room. Breaksfast room/Bar was a decent size. Can't fault the hotel at all really.. would throuoghly recommend as it is very comfortable. In a good location, but also benefits from being in a quiet street away from the hustle and bustle. Would thoroughly recommend. Enjoy your stay.

We stayed at the Giorgione at the beginning of Nov2009. During the check-in the staff was professional, they were quick (anyway, I missed some small personal something) and then we have been shown our room: a beautiful room with authentic furniture. Flat TV, mini bar, convenient bathroom - all was perfect. Breakfast was just OK - good for one or two days, but if you stayed longer it could be boring. The hotel was easy-to-find, really just 80 m walks from Piazza SS.Apostoli - a very good location to discover Venezia by foot and vaporetto.

Booked U232 Hotel as part of an Expedia air/hotel package not knowing what the hotel would be like. Had read the reviews which sounded good. Without reservation I can now highly recommend the U232. We had 3 rooms on the 2nd floor. Each room had a different layout but each one was finely appointed, exceptionally clean, with great storage for your bags, free wi fi, and one of the best bathrooms of all the hotels we stayed in over 14 days. The front staff were always extra friendly and helpful in recommending restaurants or places to visit. Bedding was comfortable as well. The hotel is located in an upscale neighborhood and within a very short walk of the nearest metro station. Rooms were quiet even from the hospital nearby never disturbing us with loud ambulance sirens or street noise. From our balcony we could view the nice college campus across the street. Would certainly stay here again.

This hotel deserves its number one ranking and it is a credit to the manager and his hard working team. The location is very good, walking distance to all major sights in French quarter, the rooms were a good size and very clean, but what makes this place is the staff. Very personal service, we were upgraded to a queen suite which was a nice surprise. The staff were only too happy to talk about the city of new orleans, with tips on where to go, best resturants etc.. We booked a swamp tour through the hotel which was great. The best advice was to head to Frenchman st and avoid Bourbon to see the real NO nightlife. Highly reccommend

We spent two nights at Hotel Grifo after a two week cruise. The hotel is located within walking distance to top "must see" sightseeing in Rome. The neighborhood is friendly and safe. The rooms are small but very clean and adequate. There was a daily continental breakfast included in the cost of the room. But the most outstanding item in this hotel is the staff !! They were the most pleasant, informative and helpful of any place I have ever stayed. If ......when I go back to Rome it will definitely include a stay at Hotel Grifo.

I did plenty of research before booking our hotel for our 5 days in Venice and was not disappointment with our choice of the Ca'Pisani. It's a smaller hotel in a cute neighborhood away from the busy tourist area of San Marco square and the Rialto bridge, but within walking distance of everything. Plus it's a quick walk straight off the water taxi - which is important when you're carrying luggage. The rooms are decorated funky with an art deco style. It's also very quiet. There were plenty of other guests staying that week but we barely ever heard anyone. We also enjoyed the steam room up on the top floor and the rooftop patio every afternoon. There are no cars in Venice so all you heard were birds chirping. Before out trip I friended the hotel on Facebook and the manager, Marianna, immediately sent me a message asking for our dates. She was very helpful with any questions I had before we arrived so if you're going to stay there, I suggest you do the same. I would love to return to Venice again and would definitely stay at the Ca'Pisani again. And if you plan on taking a gondola ride, I recommend doing it at night. During the day the canals are end to end with tons of gondolas. When we did it at night, we were the only one on mostly every canal under a moonlit sky.

The Adriano is a wonderful small hotel in Rome. We spent four nights there recently and found the experience flawless. Our room was modern and spacious (do be careful in registering because some rooms are very small and really meant for a single person). It's located in a nice neighborhood that's not far from the major tourist sites but not full of tourists. The Pantheon is a short walk as our Trevi, Spanish Steps, etc. The staff were very helpful in calling cabs, making reservations, etc. Breakfast room is bit bustling and crowded first thing in the morning but everyone is very understanding. A strong recommendation and we will certainly stay there again if we're in Rome.

This hotel is conveniently located along Wacker and is close to a few subway stops. Depending on the room you get (we got 1804), you can get gorgeous views of Lake Michigan. When we arrived at 12pm, staff were friendly and we got our room straight away. There are two elevators that cater the higher levels, so be prepared to wait a while if there is a lot of traffic. The room itself was standard; clean, not particularly spacious, shower only, working TV, toiletries, coffee and free internet. The queen bed was comfortable. For $100, it wasn't a bad deal.

Group of three ladies stayed here for 5 nights over Thanksgiving 06. I have been to NYC on several occasions, and stayed in various hotels. I decided on the apartment option as I felt I would get more space for my money, and that we did. Very spacious one bedroom apartment. $300 per night for the three of us, which was really good, For all intent and purposes the property is a hotel, with hotel check - in, concierge and daily cleaning and maid service. I would agree with other reviews that the furniture was a little dated, but functional. We had a very well equiped kitchen which was fab for storing juice and snacks. Each day our room was cleaned, towels changed and any dishes put in the dishwasher. The staff were friendly which was nice. Any requests were dealt with promptly. I booked apartment through www.apartments2book.com and the service was very professional, I would not hesitate to book with them and stay at this property again. The area is very nice, quiet around corner is grand central and the chrysler building. Excellent supermarket around corner, diner on opposite street and internet cafe on the other corner.

I stayed at the City Club for 2 nights while on a business trip. I initially picked it only because of the location (right across the street from where I needed to go), but I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was for the price I was paying (~$180 a night with our corporate rate). ROOM: Decoration of the room is very modern. Have a super-comfortable bed, spacious bathroom and nice shower. The room itself is a little small - you open the door and the bed is pretty much right there; and you stepped out of the bed, you are pretty much in the bathroom. But even though it's petite, it contains all the essentials and comfort you need (unless you want a desk to do work on - in which case, there really isn't one). LOCATION: The location is very central. Being on 44th Street, it's only a few blocks from Times Square on one side, and a few blocks from Grand Central on the other. There are a few subway stops within walking distance MISCELLANEOUS: The reception has a booklet that you can pick out free DVDs from, but I was too tired from work to borrow anything, but it is a nice-to-have. Since there is a DVD player in the room, I guess you can bring your own DVDs to watch too. Every night I come back, there is a plate of two cookies awaiting me - I thought that was a nice gesture. And when I first arrived (I arrive really early) and they allowed me to check right in, so that was nice too. They don't have a gym, but I think you can pay for a pass to use the NY Sports Club nearby. Although I don't think they open very late.

We stayed here mid-week from 21 to 25 January 2008 and our experience was superb. The hotel is situated close to Notre Dame, in a good area near to some lovely bars, cafes and restaurants. It is ideally located for exploring Paris on foot, but for the less active it is also close to a number of Metro stations. The hotel staff were faultlessly helpful and friendly. The reception staff spoke excellent English which was perfect given my rusty French. We had a room on the fifth floor which was cosy but very comfortable and warm. Outside street noise was not a problem. Most importantly, the room, bathroom and bed linen were spotlessly clean. However, some travellers may wish to take note that the size of the room and the small lift which serves each of the floors might prove problematic for wheelchairs. The hotel facilities included a small breakfast room where a decent continental breakfast was served, and an internet room. To be honest, we didn't expect or require much more. All in all this hotel was a real charm and I would certainly stay here again.

Stayed at the wonderful four seasons for 3 nights for work and sightseeing. I've stayed at many different four seasons properties across the globe and this one is better than the average four seasons. The service is great. The front desk and lobby staff are super friendly and go out of their way to helpful. They made great restaurant recommendations (metropolitan grill was my fav) and assisted us in storing/refrigerating some food we purchased at nearby Pike market. The location is great - very close to the famous pike market and acquarium (great for kids). Seattle is a terrific walking city with lots of shopping choices and we found the four seasons to be a great home base to see everything. The room was very high quality and modern. Love the in mirror tv. Always appreciate the turn down service with complimentsry bottles of water. The housekeeping staff was invisible yet they always cleaned our room whenever we left the room, which is the way it should be. Had a nice view of the water from our room. Very nice room overall. The fitness center has pretty new equipment but not much choice. Nice views of the water from the treadmill. Pool was closed, outside only and pretty small. The spa was pleasant, and massage was good like most other four seasons spas. The locker room was a bit disappointing - small with a steam room but no sauna or whirlpool. Wifi Internet worked well but was expensive. Tv choices were great - even had nfl network. Had breakfast one morning and it was uneventful as the food was very average - you're better off walking to a nearby diner. Overall I would definitely recommend the four seasons Seattle to anyone traveling to Seattle for work or fun.

Located a little way from the airport, this hotel lived up to it's good ratings. The front desk was friendly and very willing to help. I was staying a few nights with my daughter, asked for a larger room and they accommodated us no problem & no extra charge. The beds were comfortable, the towels fluffy & soft even the restaurant had a good stir fry which was a surprise. The staff apologized over & over for the time it took to get my meal, everyone ordering at once. If planes taking off bother you, ask for a room near the front of the hotel. We were fine with it, some might not be. Overall a very pleasant stay with very good service. Hats off to the front desk.

The staff was very professional, kind and courteous and everyone seemed to be genuinely happy. The room that I stayed in was absolutely amazing. The Hotel is classy and has a rooftop bar. Couldn't make it up there during their hours but appeared to be cool. The location is unbeatable - less than a block away from Venice Beach - and the balcony had a great view of the beach (it helped that the weather was great). While the room wasn't ready for an early check-in, there was maybe a ten minute wait (that was spent walking to the beach) and it was all ready. I highly recommend checking it out. Even if it is to go to the rooftop bar for a drink and a great view.

We stay at the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort for our anniversary almost every year. It seems that the hotel is improving. The hotel is small enough that we had the pools to ourselves in the morning during our mid-week stay. We love the flower filled gardens. The staff was friendly and helpful. There were good quality linnens and towels available. The location is great because it is on a side street and it is an easy walk to the main street where the restaurants are. Staying at the Roman Spa was like a healing retreat for us.

lexrank_general.summary: Hotel Navona is in perfect location if you want to walk around touristic places in Rome. The hotel is clean and has good air conditioning but there is nothing else good we can say about this place. Lots of great restaurants nearby and the close vicinity to Vatican City allows you to get a head start on the queues there!

Unlike other hotels when you stay with points, the staff was very friendly and even gave us a room upgrade. We were upgraded to a VERY large room (the size of some peoples homes) with a beautiful view of the Borghese Park and St. Peter's Dome. It is not a posh hotel, but it is a quality Marriott, and everything about the stay was just fine.

The pool was very nice and the lobby inviting, so we figured that we would be OK. We were assigned a suite on the first floor. There was also an outdoor bar by the pool, I think it stayed open til 7pm. The pool was very refreshing, and a nice size with plenty of chairs - you never had that feel that the pool was over crowed.

I booked this for a "girl friends only getway" I asked for a room with a great view. The hotel was very clean, beds were pretty comfortable, and the view was so so.The rooms are huge but bathrooms very small. Overall: We were glad to have a clean and comfortable room on the boardwalk, but will probably try another hotel closer to the boardwalk attractions next time.

We enjoyed that the rooms have a little kitchenette as the first day we went to the Jean Talon Market to buy salami, baguette, cheese, fresh fruits, and wine. The hotel was very clean and we ended up getting a free upgrade to a suite. My boyfriend and I decided to visit old Montreal for the weekend and I found great reviews about this hotel.

Overall we had a very nice trip but we expected that a 4 star hotel would be more quiet. Our room, facing the street on the fifth floor was very clean and the beds comfortable. No smoking allowed in the lobby, the restaurant, the Internet area, which is exactly what I wanted.

i'll start with the good points - hotel is in a great location, easy to walk to all the main attractions and a very short walk to a metro and train station. The hotel lobby is extremely small and really unsuitable to wind down after a day spent strolling through the magnificent city that is Barcelona. We walked everywhere because the weather was so good,most popular attractions are within 45 minutes walk.

Things to note: Whilst we stayed there, there are renovation works in the lobby, this is not noisy at all, and you will harley notice it. The Hotel is quite lovely inside and the suite we had was spacious, luxurious and everything you would want from a 5 star hotel. The pool area was lovely and a very relaxing place to be and the pool attendants and restuarant staff very attentive.

Because this appears to be a hotel for lots of coach tours, it was crowded and the breakfast staff were not very friendly (maybe they were getting to the end of a long summer?). Breakfast was average only, the hotel restaurant for diiner was lovely, but the best thing was the location, everything was quite close, excellent shopping just around the corner, and a few fab restaurants also very close by.

Overall a great experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone We would stay in this Hotel again if going to Venice. I had been looking for a hotel in Venice that had a balcony overlooking the canal and the room I booked was not a disappointment.

The plus is that you are in a quiet area and its peaceful to walk around and not crowded with tourists. Spotlessly clean,very comfortable bed and really nice staff.If you stay here you will most likely use the trams a lot so you should get a 24hr pass (7 euro) as it is 2euro60 every time you ride.

The hotel staff were very helpful with directions and recommendations, a must in the old city of Venice. We found it to be a great hotel, and would definitely stay there again if we returned to Venice. There is a full-service bar near the lobby, too, so it was easy to have a nice glass of wine before heading out to dinner. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was beautiful inside.

The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the location was quiet yet accessible to all tourist sites and the metro, and the breakfast was very nice. The staff was helpful, and the hotel has an attractive bar area for grabbing a drink before or after dinner. The hotel could not get it fixed over the Easter weekend and moved us to a beautiful room with a good view and plenty of room.

They upgraded my room to a suite for no extra charge and because it was available. A free breakfast with room, Checking in early was no problem and we even got a room upgrade to a suite. We booked this hotel because of the reviews we read on Trip Advisor and because of it's value.

The basic room was small but very clean, the hotel was quiet at night (which as we are used to a small village was great), breakfast was plentiful and very good. Great location - lots of little restaurants and bars nearby and we started to feel at home in the area very quickly. The people that work at Hotel Grifo were all very friendly and helpful.

This hotel has everything going for it and is a wonderfully relaxing home away from home for visitors to Venice. The on-site restaurant La Revista offered a very nice breakfast buffet (the best we had in Europe) and the wine and cheese bar had a wonderful if limited selection of menu items. Venice might be quite an expensive city to visit, but this place was terrific value and we had a great time.

The location of this hotel is the best, we walked EVERYWHERE in Rome. Overall it was good value for money and when we return to Rome, we'll be staying at Hotel Adriano again. The reception and lobby with very nice decorations and design but beware of the rooms, they are totally different. I booked this hotel for my husband and myself after reading the reviews of other travellers to the hotel.

While the rooms are small, we found it very clean and had a great view of the Chicago River (ask for this when booking). Overall, it's not a luxury hotel, the rooms aren't huge, but the room had the necessities and a nice view. It was an OK stay, but with so many better , more spacious hotels available in Chicago I see no reason to stay there again.

It isn't luxurious, but it is very comfortable and nicely located, and ideal for families with teenagers. We asked for a smoking room & ended up with a room on the 12th floor with a huge terrace and views of the water and the Empire State Building. The room was huge, we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite when we checked in, very nice and clean.

On my next trip, I tried the Hotel Mela up the street because it was a bit less expensive and was so sorry I'd switched..tiny, ordinary, noisy. Because it is a small hotel it does not need much of a lobby or front desk, so that was OK with me. (Bryant Park, Dinner,etc...) The desk clerk was very elegant and even gave us a room upgrade because they didn't have the room I pre-booked.

The hotel was very clean and was just what we expected of a parisian hotel. Lovely to have full length windows that opened fully.All the staff we met were very friendly and the receptionist was very helpful. The hotel is in a quiet part of Paris just off the Rue Monge and we found no problems sleeping.

Overall I would definitely recommend the four seasons Seattle to anyone traveling to Seattle for work or fun. The rooms are modern yet very uncomfortable and bathrooms are the spectacular (if you like bathrooms) The FS experience has retuned to Seattle better than ever and this is the best for business, family, or a city get away, You will not be dissapointed at the Four Seasons Seattle

We used the computer room and found it fully stocked and we were able to get boarding passes for the return flight and check email with no problem. It's a very basic hotel, but we were able to get a room over night and park our car for a week for $120. The staff made it very easy and with the helpful shuttle service added to our overall positive experience.

I highly suggest the rooftop lounge because they have an amazing view of the Venice Beach, and the drinks were great. We recently spent 3 nights at the Hotel Erwin and thought it was a fantastic place to stay. We paid extra for a sea view room but it was very noisy due to the music on the roof.

We so enjoyed the beautiful grounds and the 3 mineral pools that we make it a point to visit at least once and sometimes twice a year. The pools themselves (2 outdoor and 1 indoor) seemed clean and were lovely to wallow in! The Roman Spa in Calistoga is a wonderful place to go for pure relaxation.

meansum_general.summary: We stayed at the Hotel Veneto for three nights. It was clean and comfortable, the staff were extremely helpful and polite, and I would recommend it. The breakfast was very good. The breakfast was very good, with a wide selection of hot and cold food. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay.

Stayed here for 3 nights in May. It's a 5* hotel and you can walk to most of the major sites. The room was large and clean, but the hotel is a bit dated, but the location is perfect. You can walk to all the sites and shops and restaurants. We were lucky enough to get a room with a view of the city and the hotel is a must!

We really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Gateway. The rooms were very nice, and were in a good location for shopping, restaurants and shopping. The rooms were clean and well maintained. No complaints about this hotel. I would stay there again for sure. I would stay here again.

This hotel was fabulous! It is located on the beach and it was close to the main strip. The room was clean and spacious. I could not have asked for anything more. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Diego.

We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 5th floor with a wonderful view of the city. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Rooms are comfortable and clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Seattle for business or pleasure. If I visit again, stay here again.

We stayed in this hotel on the recommendation of a friend's house and it was great. The room was very nice, the breakfast was excellent, the staff were friendly and helpful. The price was quite reasonable as the location is excellent. We had a room on the 6th floor and was very quiet. A bit pricey but worth it.

We spent 5 nights at the hotel with my family and it was perfect. Rooms are small, but we had a great sleep in our room. Breakfast was really good, lots of choices and we had dinner in the restaurant. The location is perfect, close to the metro station and a short walk to the underground station

It was a very nice experience at the hotel - it was wonderful. The staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet was outstanding. Rooms are small, but clean and modern in design. I loved the breakfast buffet and the service.

It's a 5 star hotel in the heart of Venice. Staff are friendly, helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean, but not worth the money. Breakfast was served on a terrace of the hotel. The staff were always friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

We loved staying at the Hotel Mina in Venice. I booked this hotel through a travel agent and it was great. The room was spotless, the bathroom was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great, it was a great experience.

We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the centre of the city. The room was small, but clean and well decorated. Windows open and close to street noise. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was a bit small, but clean and well kept. Will stay here again.

This was a great find in the central location. One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at, but that was my second stay. We have been to Venice many times and this was by far the best hotel we have stayed at. The location is great, close to the train station and the ferry to the Vatican. Lovely weather, and a good night sleep. We were there for a week and had a blast. Would highly recommend this hotel.

We loved staying at this hotel, the location was perfect. It was easy to find from the train station and the subway station very close. This was a great location for us, and the staff was very helpful. We were upgraded to a suite which was a nice size and the bathroom was very clean. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for a week in January and was pleased. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and well appointed, the staff was friendly, and the room is clean and comfortable.
